title: Olympic climbing will be part of this year's games. Here's what it'll take to bring home gold
body: Running and jumping have been a staple in every Summer Olympics, and now — climbing. "Such a natural fit from the beginning of time, humans have been climbers to escape danger, and or a variety of reasons, and it's really fun," said Andrea Charest, the owner of Petra Cliffs Indoor Climbing Center in Burlington, Vermont. Olympic Climbing is a bit more structured than the "escape danger" times."There is three different disciplines that people will be combining, so it's kind of like a triathlon of climbing, basically, and they are very different disciplines. They all demand very different skill and technique," Charest said.Discipline 1: Speed climbing."It's just as fast as someone can get up a 15-meter wall," Charest said.Discipline 2: Lead or Sport Climbing."Longer climbing, basically for every hold that somebody climbs up is an additional point," Charest said.Discipline 3: Bouldering."The style is sort of three-dimensional and gymnastics, and power," Charest
